lead_paragraph: Two closely watched surveys of the manufacturing sector in China fell in June in the latest sign that Beijing's efforts to scale back stimulus measures have begun to moderate the growth of the world's largest developing nation, Bettina Wassener reports in The New York Times.
snippet: Two closely watched surveys of the manufacturing sector in China fell in June in the latest sign that Beijing's efforts to scale back stimulus measures have begun to moderate the growth of the world's largest developing nation.

headline.main: New Data Show China's Growth Slowing

abstract: Two closely watched surveys of the manufacturing sector in China fell in June in the latest sign that Beijing's efforts to scale back stimulus measures have begun to moderate the growth of the world's largest developing nation.
